p: When comparing the formulations at ambient temperature with 5Â°C, the temperature influences on stability were observed.[ 54] According to studies conducted by Hosseini, Jafari[ 55] and Leal, Sousa,[ 29] high temperatures promote a high frequency of collisions of the droplets, speeding up physical-chemical and chemical reactions, favoring the coalescence process resulting in a lower stability of the emulsions.
